text.p: These are the leading stories in the Turkish press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Several hundred thousand people attend the funeral of nationalist leader Alparslan Turkes in Ankara.
- Islamist Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan tells visiting Israeli Foreign Minister David Levy to submit to U. N. decisions and back down on building Jewish settlements in east Jerusalem.
- Turkey's unregistered trade with Russia in 1996 was $11 billion, compared to the registered trading of $4 billion for the same year.
- Foreign Minister Tansu Ciller is trying to silence two ministers in her party who object to the continuation of the coalition with the Islamist Welfare Party.
- State Minister Salim Ensarioglu says government will spend 119 trillion Turkish lira from the 1997 budget on the under developed southeast.
- A court decides the sacking of national police chief Alaadin Yuksel was against the law.
- State Minister Ufuk Soylemez says treasury will open no new tenders until the end of April.
- Erbakan orders his party's MPs to be present in the celebrations of national holiday on 23rd April marking the foundation of the secular Republic.
